metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1520 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
When viewing an email message A, which contains an attached message B,where B is encrypted or digitally signed or both, Thunderbird may show anincorrect encryption or signature status. After opening and viewing theattached message B, when returning to the display of message A, the messageA might be shown with the security status of message B. This vulnerabilityaffects Thunderbird < 91.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1520` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
